column4: My Ubuntu 11.10 computer is not booting up. The unlock hard drive screen has characters which look like blocks, and does not continue thereafter. Even in recovery mode, it doesn't continue after the component loading. Any ideas?
unlock hdd screen ?
oh my hdd is lvm encryped, so yea.
does it reports any errors ?
nope
you just installed ubuntu or upgraded or what ?
upgraded.
hmm i have not used lvm encryption before so idk the steps. it hangs there ? between GRUB and boot splash ?
yep it hangs there with a black screen. Same in recovery mode.
can you press ctrl alt f1 and log in ?
let me try
it says Unable to connect to system bus: Failed to connect to socket /var/run/dbus/system_bus_socket: Connection refused. Apparently I can read the unlock screen now.
then look for the errors from there. sorry idk about lvm encryption stuffs. aks others.
okay i can login from command line.
startx
also run "dmesg" to display msgs
xauth: file /home/administrator/.Xauthority does not exist. Invalid MIT-MAGIC-COOKIE-1 keyxinit: giving up. xinit: unable to connect to X server: Connection refused. xinit: server error.
try "sudo service lightdm start"
well for starters it shows a complete black screen.
yup complete black
returned to command line using ctrl+alt+f1
hmm then no clue. maybe run "dmesg | less" then read the log, look for errors
don't really see any
anyways thanks for trying.
